org.apache.juneau.rest.client2

Class RestRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanSession
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.client2.RestRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, HttpUriRequest, HttpMessage, HttpRequest

    public final class RestRequest
extends BeanSession
implements HttpUriRequest, Configurable
    Represents a request to a remote REST resource.

    Instances of this class are created by the various creator methods on the RestClient class.

    • RestClient
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected RestRequest(RestClient client, HttpRequestBase request, URI uri)
      Constructs a REST call with the specified method name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestRequest

        protected RestRequest(RestClient client,
                      HttpRequestBase request,
                      URI uri)
               throws RestCallException
        Constructs a REST call with the specified method name.
        Parameters:
        client - The client that created this request.
        request - The wrapped Apache HTTP client request object.
        uri - The URI for this call.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.

    • Method Detail

      • serializer

        public RestRequest serializer(Serializer serializer)
        Specifies the serializer to use on this request body.

        Overrides the serializer specified on the RestClient.

        Parameters:
        serializer - The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • errorCodes

        public RestRequest errorCodes(Predicate<Integer> value)
        Allows you to override what status codes are considered error codes that would result in a RestCallException.

        The default error code predicate is: x -> x >= 400.

        Parameters:
        value - The new predicate for calculating error codes.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If init method on interceptor threw an exception.

      • uri

        public RestRequest uri(Object uri)
                throws RestCallException
        Sets the URI for this request.

        Can be any of the following types:

        • URI
        • URL
        • URIBuilder
        • Anything else converted to a string using Object.toString().

        Relative URL strings will be interpreted as relative to the root URL defined on the client.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URL of the remote REST resource.
        This overrides the URI passed in from the client.
        Can be any of the following types:
        • URIBuilder
        • URI
        • URL
        • String
        • Object - Converted to String using toString()
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid URI syntax detected.

      • path

        public RestRequest path(String name,
                        Object value,
                        HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                        HttpPartSchema schema)
                 throws RestCallException
        Replaces a path parameter of the form "{name}" in the URL.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string.
        • If null, then the HttpPartSerializer defined on the client is used (OpenApiSerializer by default).
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Error occurred.

      • path

        public RestRequest path(String name,
                        Object value)
                 throws RestCallException
        Replaces a path parameter of the form "{name}" in the URL.
        Example:

        client .get("/{foo}") .path("foo", "bar") .run();

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid input.

        public RestRequest path(Object bean)

      • path

        public RestRequest path(Object... pairs)
                 throws RestCallException
        Replaces path parameters of the form "{name}" in the URL using free-form key/value pairs.
        Example:

        client .get("/{foo}/{bar}") .path("foo","val1","bar","val2") .run();

        Parameters:
        pairs - The path key/value pairs.
        • Values can be any POJO.
        • Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid input.

      • query

        public RestRequest query(String name,
                         Object value,
                         boolean skipIfEmpty,
                         HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                         HttpPartSchema schema)
                  throws RestCallException
        Adds a query parameter to the URI.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the parameter if the value is empty.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string.
        • If null, then the HttpPartSerializer defined on the client is used (OpenApiSerializer by default).
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Error occurred.

      • query

        public RestRequest query(String name,
                         Object value)
                  throws RestCallException
        Adds a query parameter to the URI.
        Example:

        client .get(URL) .query("foo", "bar") .run();

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid input.

      • query

        public RestRequest query(NameValuePair param,
                         boolean skipIfEmpty)
                  throws RestCallException
        Adds a query parameter to the URI.
        Example:

        client .get(URL) .query(new NameValuePair("foo", ""), true) // Will be skipped .run();

        Parameters:
        param - The query parameter.
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the parameter if the value is null or empty.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid input.

                  throws RestCallException

        RestCallException - Invalid input.

      • formData

        public RestRequest formData(String name,
                            Object value,
                            boolean skipIfEmpty,
                            HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                            HttpPartSchema schema)
                     throws RestCallException
        Adds a form-data parameter to the request body.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the parameter if the value is empty.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string.
        • If null, then the HttpPartSerializer defined on the client is used (OpenApiSerializer by default).
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Error occurred.

      • formData

                            Object value)

        RestCallException - Invalid input.

      • body

        public RestRequest body(Object input)
                 throws RestCallException
        Sets the body of this request.
        Parameters:
        input - The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
        Can be of the following types:
        • Reader - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource.
        • InputStream - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource.
        • ReaderResource - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource. Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
        • StreamResource - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource. Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
        • Object - POJO to be converted to text using the Serializer registered with the RestClient.
        • HttpEntity - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
        • NameValuePairs - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If a retry was attempted, but the entity was not repeatable.

      • body

        public RestRequest body(Object input,
                        HttpPartSchema schema)
                 throws RestCallException
        Sets the body of this request.
        Parameters:
        input - The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
        Can be of the following types:
        • Reader - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource.
        • InputStream - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource.
        • ReaderResource - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource. Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
        • StreamResource - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource. Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
        • Object - POJO to be converted to text using the Serializer registered with the RestClient.
        • HttpEntity - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
        • NameValuePairs - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If a retry was attempted, but the entity was not repeatable.

      • header

        public RestRequest header(String name,
                          Object value,
                          boolean skipIfEmpty,
                          HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                          HttpPartSchema schema)
                   throws RestCallException
        Sets a header on the request.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        value - The header value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the header if the value is empty.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string.
        • If null, then the HttpPartSerializer defined on the client is used (OpenApiSerializer by default).
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Error occurred.

      • accept

        public RestRequest accept(Object value)
                   throws RestCallException
        Sets the value for the Accept request header.

        This overrides the media type specified on the parser, but is overridden by calling header("Accept", value);

        Parameters:
        value - The new header value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid input.

      • maxForwards

        public RestRequest maxForwards(Object value)
                        throws RestCallException
        Sets the value for the Max-Forwards request header.

        This is a shortcut for calling header("Max-Forwards", value);

        Parameters:
        value - The new header value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - Invalid input.

      • run

        public RestResponse run()
                 throws RestCallException
        Runs this request and returns the resulting response object.
        Example:

        try { int rc = client.get(URL).execute().getResponseStatus(); // Succeeded! } catch (RestCallException e) { // Failed! }

        • Calling this method multiple times will return the same original response object.
        • You must close the returned object if you do not consume the response or execute a method that consumes the response.
        • If you are only interested in the response code, use the execute() method which will automatically consume the response so that you don't need to call InputStream.close() on the response body.
        Returns:
        The response object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.

      • runFuture

        public Future<RestResponse> runFuture()
                               throws RestCallException
        Same as run() but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
        Example:

        Future<RestResponse> f = client.get(URL).runFuture(); // Do some other stuff try { String body = f.get().getBody().asString(); // Succeeded! } catch (RestCallException e) { // Failed! }

        • Use the RestClientBuilder.executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) method to customize the executor service used for creating Futures.
        Returns:
        The HTTP status code.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If the executor service was not defined.

      • execute

        public RestResponse execute()
                     throws RestCallException
        Same as run() but immediately calls RestResponse.consume() to clean up the response.

        Use this method if you're only interested in the status line of the response and not the response entity. Attempts to call any of the methods on the response object that retrieve the body (e.g. RestResponseBody.asReader() will cause a RestCallException to be thrown.

        • You do not need to execute InputStream.close() on the response body to consume the response.
        Example:

        // Get the response code. // No need to call close() on the RestResponse object. int rc = client.get(URL).execute().getResponseCode();

        Returns:
        The response object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.

      • executeFuture

        public Future<RestResponse> executeFuture()
                                   throws RestCallException
        Same as execute() but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
        Example:

        Future<RestResponse> f = client.get(URL).executeFuture(); // Do some other stuff int rc = f.get().getResponseStatus();

        • Use the RestClientBuilder.executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) method to customize the executor service used for creating Futures.
        • You do not need to execute InputStream.close() on the response body to consume the response.
        Returns:
        The HTTP status code.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If the executor service was not defined.

      • abort

        public void abort()
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Aborts this http request. Any active execution of this method should return immediately. If the request has not started, it will abort after the next execution.
        Aborting this request will cause all subsequent executions with this request to fail.
        Specified by:
        abort in interface HttpUriRequest
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

      • getHeaders

        public Header[] getHeaders(String name)
        Returns all the headers with a specified name of this message. Header values are ignored.
        Headers are ordered in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.
        Specified by:
        getHeaders in interface HttpMessage
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the headers to return.
        Returns:
        The headers whose name property equals name.

      • getFirstHeader

        public Header getFirstHeader(String name)
        Returns the first header with a specified name of this message. Header values are ignored.
        If there is more than one matching header in the message the first element of getHeaders(String) is returned.
        If there is no matching header in the message null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getFirstHeader in interface HttpMessage
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header to return.
        Returns:
        The first header whose name property equals name or null if no such header could be found.

      • getLastHeader

        public Header getLastHeader(String name)
        Returns the last header with a specified name of this message. Header values are ignored.
        If there is more than one matching header in the message the last element of getHeaders(String) is returned.
        If there is no matching header in the message null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getLastHeader in interface HttpMessage
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header to return.
        Returns:
        The last header whose name property equals name or null if no such header could be found.
